metadata.title: CVE-2012-4002 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in GLPI-PROJECT GLPI before0.83.3 allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of unspecifiedvictims via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.83.31-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glpi package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.83.31-1').
